instruction: How does the performance of the PLSR model with SSI compare to traditional methods in estimating soil salt content from Landsat data?
Output: The performance of the PLSR model with SSI (Soil Salt Indices) in estimating soil salt content from Landsat data is better than traditional methods. The study found that PLSR with SSI performed the best for both simulated Landsat 5 and Landsat 8 data. Compared to other techniques such as support vector machine (SVM) and deep learning (DL), PLSR with SSI provided more accurate estimations of soil salt content. SVM underestimated the soil salt content, while DL obtained centralized simulations and failed to capture the lower and upper observations. Therefore, the study recommends using the PLSR model with SSI as independent variables (IV) for estimating soil salt content from Landsat data.
